25940395.review:
A very touching kinetic novel (meaning there are no choices to be made), with great art, some absolutely gorgeous and emotional music tracks and a powerful climax. Suffice to say I've considerably inflated my in-game hours just by listening to some of its poignant tunes on repeat (roughly 1/3 of my playtime was spent on them at the time of my writing this), and that's a first for me. 
It's short lived, granted, lasting 3 hours or so depending on how fast you read, but that takes nothing away from the tale. In fact, I feel it went on for the perfect length for me to sucesfully connect to the characters yet leave the world cloaked in bleakness, solitude and mistery, which ultimately adds to the game's narrative and overall feel. Oh, and definitely expect tears to be shed or at the very least choked up at some point. More than worth it at normal price, a no brainer at a sale.
tl;dr: Short but sweet kinetic VN with a stellar soundtrack and some real feels to be had.

どんな時も消して消えることのない
美しむきゅうのキラメキ。
満点の星々が皆様をお待ちています[/quote]

Got this game on a bundle and it's been sitting on my library for a few months. Decided to download it just so I can read a VN.

The pacing of this game is really weird. It starts of really slow, without nothing really happening. It just plays out nicely so you can get attached to the only two characters of this game, the unnamed "Junker" and Hoshino Yumemi. Everything in this VN is just character development with nothing ground breaking happening. At times, you might get annoyed with your robot companion, at times the feels monster will attack you and just smash everything out.

I wouldn't go as far to say that this VN is beautiful, compared to the other kinetic ones I've seen, but it's paced just right to get the conclusion right.

As other reviewers say, prepare some tissues for the feels trip right at the end.

关于steam版本调日文乱码的问题：
各种转区工具无效，挣扎许久后终于找到方法（滑稽）
去网上找了汉化版发现还是不能运行（第一张图后闪退），然后去贴吧找到解决方法：
把游戏目录（网上找的汉化版游戏）中的字体文件（jpfont.TTF）复制在c:\WINDOWS\Fonts\下就能运行
回到steam版，删除本地内容重新下载再选日文，一进去会弹出一个选择字体的框框，会发现只有一个字体（jpfont.TTF)
选择后竟然没有乱码了（难道这字体两边通用么2333）

25726171.review:
[h1]◆ 「プラネタリウムはいかがでしょう？」[/h1]
最終戦争の後､制御機構を失った自律戦闘兵器が跋扈し､
降り止まぬ雨が徐々に地上を飲み込んでいく､荒廃した世界｡
使用可能な物資の回収を生業とする『屑屋』の男は､廃墟と化した
プラネタリウムで謎のロボット少女に遭遇してしまう｡そして――
という趣旨の､VisualArtsKey製のノベルゲーム｡
元は2004年に発売された物で､分類的にはいわゆる泣きゲー｡
今年7月にWEBアニメ化され､本作はその原作に当たる｡
また､後日談となる劇場版が9月現在全国で公開中である｡
（ここで公開中の映画にまで触れるのはアレなのでそちらは割愛）

[h1]◆ 主にゆめみちゃんが可愛い[/h1]
ノベルゲームだが､選択肢は一切なく読み進めていくだけ｡
ネタバレを避けつつ内容に触れるならば､やはり何はなくとも
ヒロインのゆめみちゃんの可愛さ・健気さに尽きる｡
世界が滅び去ったことも､人類が絶滅寸前であることも､
もう本当の星空は見えないことも知らず､人知れず稼働し続け､
無人のプラネタリウムで接客を続けていたロボット少女……｡
このシチュだけでグッと来てしまうなら買って後悔はしないはず｡

話としては短く､3,4時間で全実績解除と共に全て読み切れる｡
ただし､繰り返しになるが､本作はいわゆる泣きゲーであり､
短いながらも心に残る感動を与えてくれる傑作である｡
鍵ゲーとしては､Kanon､Air､CLANNADという
名作群に次いで発売された作品であり､以降は智アフ､リトバスと
続いていく中で､何となく目立ってない印象があるものの､
プレイ後感で言えばこれらに引けを取っておらず､むしろ
この短さでこの破壊力という点でもっと評価されるべきだと思う｡

[h1]◆ 絵文字や壁紙も欲しかった……[/h1]
フルボイス・日本語完全対応｡トレカ非対応で定価は高め｡
バンドル入りしたこともなく､値引き率も毎度渋いが､メシを
1,2食抜くぐらいの我慢をしてでも買う価値は間違いなくある｡
鍵ゲーお得意の痛い電波キャラや､なんか謎の奇跡が起きて
全て丸く収まっちゃうご都合主義展開のような要素はなく､
きっちり筋道立てた正統派SF作品として仕上がっているので､
年齢性別問わずおすすめできる｡ちなみに本日9月28日は､
WEBアニメ全5話収録のBD発売日である｡アニメも原作準拠で
良かったのでおすすめ（ダイレクトマーケティング）｡

25719498.review:
Every visual novel is like a book, either it's a good read or it's a boring read.  This visual novel starts slow but becomes an extordinarly good read.

Planetarian revolves around the three themes of war, trust, and innocence from start to finish.  It starts off feeling kind of hokey, but the story is self aware of that because the main protagonist intialy feels much the same way about the situation he finds himself in.

In summary the main protagonist stumbles upon an abandoned planetarium in a war torn ruin.  What he finds there is a robot girl, a greeter for the planetarium, who appears to be blissfuly unaware that it has been thirty years since the world was destroyed in nuclear war.  Her ignorance is exasperating yet her earnestness is oddly endearing and the main protagonist finds himself slowly warming up to her.  And chances are you will too.

This visual novel can be a slow read at times, the spacing between letters is atrocious, and the whole story is dripping with setimentality.  And yet if you can get past that you will find that this is a read that will draw you in with some of the best writing I have ever seen in a short story.  The entire read will only take you about 2-3 hours, so I recommend reading it on a free afternoon or a chapter every now and again when you need a break from a hard day.

25711898.review:
Будет ласковый дождь - рассказ написанный Брэдбери Рэем, повествующий о умной доме, уцелевшем после ядерной войны. В программу дома входило, обслуживать семью живших там, делать их жизнь комфортной. Каждый день, питаясь от солнечных батарей, дом выполнял инструкции вложенные в него: приготовить еду, включить телевизор, разложить стол для покера и так далее. Так продолжалось до тех пор, пока дом не сгорел. Хоть в рассказе действующим лицом было не одушевленное лицо, все равно было искренне жаль изобретение человека, созданное для его же комфорта. Дом продолжал выполнять программу заложенную в мирное время, он не понимал, что семьи больше нет - от них остались лишь тени на асфальте, а все в радиусе 1000 миль, радиоактивная помойка. Продолжал выполнять программу заложенную в мирное время, программа которая как эхо мирных лучших времен, раздавалась среди радиоактивной помойки.
Именно с этим рассказом, у меня возникла ассоциация с этим шедевром. Также и Юмэни не понимала, вернее не хотела понимать, что все вокруг разрушенно, что в планетарий никто не придет. Девушка-андройд выполняющая ежедневную программу,как эхо раздается среди разрушенного войной города. Илюзорный маленький мир , который она создавала в планетарии, тронул главного героя и меня, унося в мир звезд. Невольно задал себе вопрос: а когда я смотрел на звездное небо? Мне искринне жаль её,хоть она и не живая, но она гораздо человечней тех, кто поворачивал ключи и нажимал на кнопки в ядерных шахтах. Подобные произведения заставляют задуматься, какое наследие оставит после себя человек? Полет к дальним звездам, исполняя мечту Юмэми  и тысяч мечтателей, с романтическим взглядом глядящих в небо или....радиоактивный пепел....
К сожалению, второе более вероятно.

25389847.review:
我是本馆的解说员，名字是星野梦美。

请大家记住，即使有一天，星星的世界不再是遥不可及的梦想，而是成为了生活的一部分……也请大家不要把在这里看到的星空忘却。当您迷失在黑暗中，看不到真正的星空的时候，就请静静地将它回想起来吧。这是……我的、小小的梦想。

《星之梦》是Key社制作的AVG冒险游戏，和Kanon和Air同属于VisualArt's Novel视觉小说，玩家没有任何的选择，只能阅读故事，按照固定的剧情和分支进行游戏。游戏最初发行于2004年11月29日，现在具有Windows,PS2,FOMA,PSP,Android,IOS版本。相关衍生作品有轻小说，广播剧，动画等。虽然游戏只有短短几小时的剧情，但是却能给玩家带来无限的感动。

游戏背景设置在因30年前的战争破坏而充满废墟和荒芜的世界，自然资源枯竭，人类接近消亡的边缘，玩家作为男主角废墟猎人，在一座废弃都市中的天象馆中邂逅本作女主角星野梦美，“欢迎大家光临天象馆，这里有着无论何时都决不会消失的，美丽无穷的光辉，满天的星星们正在等待着大家的到来。”

男主角是一名废墟猎人，带有武器和各种生存装备，想尽一切办法在这个崩坏的世界中生存下去，女主角是天象馆的招待机器人，已经被废弃了30年，稍微有些故障，不知道外面的世界发生了怎样的变化。

男主角遇到星野梦美后，星野梦美想向顾客展示美丽的星象投影，但是投影仪却早已坏掉，在修好投影仪后，漫天繁星遍布天空，引发人们无限遐想，因为电源用尽，主角不愿看到梦美因此永远停止工作，于是将她带了出来，但是却遇到了守卫机器人，经过一番战斗，在最后，星野梦美用自己小小的身体替男主角挡下了机器人的炮火，微笑的倒下了。

“我没有遵守您的重要命令，真的是非常对不起……因为，我有一个更为古老的承诺，我绝不可以危害人，或在人面临危险的时候坐视不管……我们，是机器人。所以，这对我们来说，是无法忘却的承诺。这项承诺，是我们机器人的，骄傲……我代替他，向您表示深深的歉意，我想，他也一定是出现故障了才会这样的……我们机器人，是为了人们的幸福而存在的；我想它一定也是不愿意做这种粗暴的事情的”。

“我是廉价版机体，不会流泪……如果我有搭载这个机能……我想，我现在一定在流泪……”电源逐渐耗尽，星野梦美向男主角分享了自己的美好的记忆，虽然星野梦美仿佛早已知道这一切的一切都是善意的谎言，但是依然对未来满怀期待，请不要将人和机器人的天堂分开。

“欢迎大家光临天象馆，这里有着无论何时都决不会消失的，美丽无穷的光辉，满天的星星们正在等待着大家的到来。“这是星野梦美的第一句话，也是最后的一句话。

25032421.review:
之前从PSP上玩过盗版，使我深受感动与震撼，眼泪在这个游戏面前竟如此廉价……

从steam上买这款游戏的初衷是为了给个好评，但当我再一次打开游戏，那浩瀚的星空和善良真挚的梦美再次吸引了我，吸引着我再一次感受了这个美丽的悲剧……

即使外面的世界已满目疮痍，即使丑陋的人类为了一己私欲而不停厮杀，即使最基本的信任已成奢求，即使……那无情的雨好似毁灭了一切……但它没有侵蚀梦美纯洁的心灵。

淅沥缠绵的雨腐蚀了人的情感，但它腐蚀不了世间永存的美好。

梦美真的倒下了吗？也许倒下的只是她的躯体，而被救赎的是一个贪婪麻木的废墟猎人。正如动漫中男主最后所说：“我是传颂星星之人。”

[h1]“悲剧是将人生有价值的东西毁灭给人看。”——鲁迅《论雷峰塔的倒掉》[/h1]

感受过许多探索人性的作品，但《星之梦》将在我的心中永远占据峰顶。

25013520.review:
I didn't think I'd cry over a game about a robot and her planetarium, but here I am.

Key, true to form, has made yet another wonderful visual novel here. And, with the anime adaptation coming out, there's no better time to play this treasure of a game. The abridged version of the plot is, "Dude meets an upbeat robot girl in an abandoned town and learns about the stars--along with the power of friendship." It's so much more than that, obviously, but I don't want to get into spoilers! It's the kind of game where you should go in not knowing much.

I was pleasantly surprised; long story short, I got it on sale ($3) around March-ish, so I wasn't expecting much when I played it on a whim now. Though, the normal asking price, $9.99, isn't a stretch. It's an incredibly well-made game, and the production value is easily worth that.

This visual novel is short, and there's no decisions to make, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. The player is taken along for a ride with this loving robot and her world-weary pal, the protagonist, for just the right amount of time. Not too long, not too little.

The voice acting, even if there's only 2 main characters, was stellar. You don't see the protagonist at all, nor do you get a name for him besides "Mr. Customer", but you get more than enough background through his memories, which do a wonderful job of worldbuilding. We have a lot of "showing, not telling", which I really appreciate. On that note, the writing was also charming, especially in the more poignant bits.

Plus, the CGs? The music? Lovely.

All in all, if you want a touching, moving experience, put aside 4 hours of your day to play this game. You won't regret it.

24986366.review: feels here, feeels there. 5/7 would feels again

24967500.review:
I thouroughly enjoyed this little story.  The pacing was a bit slow around the middle, but I think that the concise story-line and details pertaining to "Mr Customers" backstory (and of course the post-apocolyptic setting) more than made up for it.  The character dynamic and interaction was a bit stifled and repeditive at times (though that was part of Yumemis character) but its what makes their dialouge all the more touching as the story progresses.  "Mr Customers" inner monolouge, while providing all necessary information, was lengthy at times, and I get the feeling the writers used it to stretch the story out longer than it needed to be.  
They kept the story and characters simple, and didn't try to make any points about society or humanity, which I particularly appreciated.  This one's a tear jerker to be sure.  Overall, I really liked Planetarian, and if you are interested, it has been made into an anime available on Funimation (although the backstorys are cut out).

For all it's good points, there was one thing that all but ruined it for me.  They chose to include a tune that while most likely unknown to people outside of the USA, is very much known within it, and is strictly associated with a particularly nasty religion, as it is a church hymn.  The fact that they used it at some of the most emotional moments ruined the mood entirely.  I was very dissappointed by this, and wish they had done more research.  Oh well.  I still recommend it.

24953703.review:
[b] Затем пошёл дождь.
Дождь падал без различия дня и ночи, украв у мира солнечный свет, уничтожив и зиму, и лето.
Он отравил воду и почву, выжег растения, раскрошил бетон и превратил сталь в ржавый мусор.
От мира осталась лишь грязь, пропитанная ядом, да молчаливые руины. [/b]

[i] Перед нами кинетическая новелла примерно на один вечер чтения. Выпущена она была студией Key в 2004 году, но невзирая на год выпуска, она прекрасна. Возможно она оттолкнёт среднестатистического игрока своим малым количеством локаций, тематикой или другими факторами, которые у нынешних новелл на более высоком уровне, но я попытаюсь вас переубедить. [/i]

[i] Действия игры разворачиваются в недалеком будущем, в так называемом "запечатанном городе", где ранее происходила довольно серьезная война с использованием самых разных вариаций оружия. Во время путешествия мы будем следить за отношениями Старьёвщика, по совместительству главного героя, который ходит по пустым городам в поисках разных вещей, и девочки-робота, Хосино Юмеми, излучающей вечный оптимизм. Она осталась в заброшенном Планетарии, когда происходила эвакуация города и продолжает ждать своих посетителей. [/i]

[i] Атмосфера в этой игре просто на высшем уровне. Я не только чувствовал определенно тяжелую атмосферу улицы, вечного дождя и разрухи. Но и уют Планетария, оптимизм девочки-робота, замечательные рассказы о звёздах. Огромное спасибо Кеям за саундтрек, он получился отменный. И конечно же я не оставляю без внимания перевод наших фанатов, спасибо вам огромное, WinKiller Studio. [/i]

[i] Рисовка в этой игре аналогично на хорошем уровне, даже для 2016 года. Единственное огорчает, что разрешение только 800x600, и у вас будут черные полосы по бокам, но это почти не заметно, ибо всё окупается атмосферой, саундтреком и текстом. [/i]

[i] В заключении хочу сказать, Planetarian замечательная история, из которой можно сделать огромные выводы, задуматься о будущем, пережить те немногие моменты радости и печали, погрузиться в этот забытый мир с головой. [/i]

[b] Следующая проекция начнётся через 13 минут.
Пожалуйста, заходите и присаживайтесь где вам будет удобнее. [/b]

24708816.review:
自己也是很多年前就知道了，但当时没有中文（现在贴吧有汉化的资源，无汉化补丁）key社的游戏真的不敢玩多了，但这部真的很想玩。。关于星空的话题无论何时我都乐于去倾听！
 7月才因为动画想起来，所以看了一集动画就直接去玩游戏了，然后steam这也入了正。不过steam没中文 所以入了就当支持，玩还是玩贴吧版。。。


   玩游戏的时候感受到里面所包含的深深的人文关怀。。。尤其是梦美讲解那一段。对应的就是动画第三集。故事中的人类已经被自己毁灭，一切都葬送了。  {而星海的梦想，未来的美好却由废墟中的机器人守护着，做着最后的传承，讲着最后的故事，曾经人类的辉煌与梦想通过梦美的描述传达给了男主。}既是一种讽刺也是一种警醒。 不过在剧情中就是传承吧，由【过去】的机器人传达给【现在】废墟中的人。

虽然机器人不知道，停留在过去，但听故事的人却永远不会忘记，会将人类的梦传递下去吧（希望如此啊，所以相比游戏 动画的确是多了丝希望和慰藉）
——————不知道到底是动画还是游戏的感想还是评测  另外期待剧场版正片 星之人 据说这部游戏和7月的5集动画是那个的前传 期待后面的故事 另外贴吧好资源好感想也有很多！梦美的表情包也有分享~

不得不佩服本世纪初的这些galgame鬼才剧作家，能够谱写出这样美妙的故事 甚至一句话就能让人感动 这都是人类文化的瑰宝啊

24615913.review:
ノベルゲーム。
30年前に大きな戦争が起き物資の奪い合いが続いている荒廃した世界を舞台に、放棄された都市の戦前から時間が止まったかのようなプラネタリウムで1人の男とロボットの少女「ほしのゆめみ」との交流を描いた内容だ。
フルボイスのビジュアルノベルで選択肢はない。本作の魅力といったら、やはりヒロインのほしのゆめみの存在だろう。
ゆめみは終始ロボットとしての使命を貫き続ける。コンパニオンロボットとして接客目的に作られたためか屑屋のどんなセリフに対しても、ポジティブな返答を行う。とにかく健気でひたむきだ、それがプログラムされたものであったとしても。自律思考の結果を何かのエラーだとしか認識できない無垢でもある。そんな彼女が終盤でひとつの自分自身の「願い」を語る。それはほんのささやかもので、ゆめみ自身が悲しいと思っていなくても憐憫を誘う。
また、基本的に2人しか登場しないのに関わらず、屑屋の視点でゆめみの特徴がよく描かれており、彼の微妙な心情の変化も丁寧に表現されているためか、物語に入りやすく感じられる。ボリュームは多くはないが読後には十分な満足感を与えてくる良いノベルだ。ビジュアルノベルが好きならオススメする。

24539670.review:
Welp, this game has been sitting in my library long enough that I forgot to review it. (I already finished it, scrubs)

[i]"The unceasing Rain──
The 『sealed city』,
abandoned 30 years ago after a sudden biochemical warhead strike.
The uninhabited ruins,
ruled over only by autonomous battle drones.
The man came to this place,
finding shelter inside a tall building as he grew exhausted,
and there he came across
a planetarium,
a room that once filled the hearts of men
with the wonders of all the stars in all the sky.
And there, he met a young woman
whose name was 「Reverie」.
A member of the planetarium’s help staff
who had continued to wait for customers for over 30 years;
a broken robot──
Entreated by 「Reverie」,
he lost track of time as he repaired
the nonfunctional planetarium projector.
The continuous Rain.
Those quiet days spent with 「Reverie」.
A long-lost nostalgia that began to arise in the man’s heart.
What will he think about this sky of manmade stars?
And what is the fate of this 「Reverie」 of a little planet?"[/i]

So basically, Planetarian ~the reverie of a little planet~ is another one of Key's kinetic novel (A Visual Novel in which there are no choices whatsoever) where it tells the story of a female robot and a "junker". Key; the creators of Air, Kanon, Clannad, Little Busters, Rewrite, and Angel Beats. (There are also 3 - 5 others)

This game makes you appreciate the heartwarming and bittersweet story, only to be torn apart and have tears rolling down your face in the end. The length, it's short, which is around 4 - 5 hours. The music and sound effects, I wouldn't cry in the end without the help of it. As for the art, the CG, sprites, backgrounds and the like, pretty decent I must say. Personally, I would recommend such splendidly-made VN to players whether them being new or experienced players in the VN industry. I give it a 9/10.

Yes, I cried. And yes, tissues. You need tissues. ALWAYS TISSUES.
Ooooor maybe you can just cry yourself on the ground.  :>

24469486.review:
Big names, any preceeding projects you've made as a developer which have managed to be a hit, can be a great way to lure a fanbase into expecting or anticipating your next possible product.
As such, I saw those familiar, renowned names of creations which have cautivated many hearts, [b]NOT[/b] including mine.
I decided to give this a try, unsurprisingly, since I can't get my money back, I can only write down why this [b]VN[/b] has failed my expectations.
I could maybe even say [b]this is one the most mediocrily-executed VNs i've played[/b].

[b][h1]Story[/h1][/b]
Quite simple, maybe shallow and cliché one could even argue, it could still be amazing, but throughout the [b]VN[/b], you are only fed info on how things went down by very limited paraghaphs and moments that barely relate to the present besides being short "flashbacks".
One could argue the Robot gal is the focus, if that's the case, what happens around her is so dreadfully repetitive that is just a chore to experience, as bottom-line, is [b]Unengaging and brutally loopy[/b].

[b][h1]Cast[/h1][/b]
To start, abysmally small, two people is all this [b]VN[/b] has to offer, 1 and 1/2 since you barely learn about yourself.
Your persona is just a whiny and old-fashioned war-torn grump, contrasted by the cheerful, but way too cloying Robot.
As such, [b]Bare minimum for character build, but very limited nontheless[/b].

[b][h1]Writing[/h1][/b]
If I can praise something is the absence of any kind of Typos, vocabulary is pretty well diversed and does a great job to explain things to you whenever the situations arises.
However, it does take its sweet time with completely unrelated and meaningless dumps of information about the past (Which barely even relate to the current situation), You do learn and spend enough time with the Robot to make the end sad enough, so is just [b]Roller-coaster'y[/b].

[b][h1]Graphics[/h1][/b]
[b]The Robot girl is the peak of quality[/b], that pretty much sums it up.
The Atmosphere built visually rarely ever attempts to be unnerving or post-apocalyptic, unless you consider the abundancy of empty places a sign of the upcoming Armageddon.
At times is just outright lazy, plastering White or Black screens at vital moments or making you stare to a static image for around 1 min without variation.

[b][h1]Soundtrax[/h1][/b]
By itself, it has some pretty catchy tunes and a few more sentimental, melodic ones for those rare instances.
However by itself, consider the tone the game takes, is [b]good music, but very unfitting[/b] overall, a dystopian building is accompanied by the most cheerful of tunes, and tense moments are musically accompanied by static noises or 5-sec loops.

[b][h1]Duration[/h1][/b]
For a [b]VN[/b], [b]while not extremely short, it does have a pretty limited Duration[/b], no Alternatives for replay value, what you see for the first time is what you'll see every single time with no variation.

[b][h1]tl;dr[/h1][/b]
You do not have anything to gain from this, the Price does not reflect the time of the [b]VN[/b] you'll be enjoying to the fullest, Get it if you want the bragging rights of having a [b]VN[/b] from well-known names, otherwise, don't bother with it.

As such, I shall grant this game the dreaded...
[h1][b][u]Bucket[/u] [u]of[/u] [u]Raindrops[/u]/10[/b][/h1]

24415746.review:
Key, such an amazing studio. I don't do reviews nor am I good at them but I wanted to leave my thoughts somewhere for this particular one so....ye

[i]Why don't you come to the planetarium? 
The beautiful twinkling of eternity that will never fade, no matter what. 
All the stars in the sky are waiting for you. [/i]

Albeit this catchphrase can become slightly annoying after a while, it is very well utilized throughout the story imo.It reminds me that the girl is most definitively a mere robot whose sole purpose is to entertain the customers of the planetarium she works in. 
The story is set in a post-apocalyptic setting, in a city of bereft of life and of never-ending rain. Unable to assess the consequences war brought to humanity, she can only act the way she has always been programmed to act. The sight of an innocent robot practicing her usual greeting speech in the emptiness, waiting for a customer to pass by left me with a tint of sadness.

The little chitter chatter that compose the majority of Planetarian lays out the character development for the main character. A man broken by war and stripped of all emotions, simply set on survival, meets a robot built for a world devoid of harm, just how annoyed could he be upon this encounter? As a Key game, it was no mystery that it would end up in feels agh...He slowly would get attached to this broken robot. The turning point being obviously the projection of the planetarium. To a man who lived his entire life under the storming clouds, millions of twinkling stars must've been a glimpse of hope, telling him this world can still be saved...

This is the first time I played a visual novel (if you can exclude nekopara =.=), and the voice-acting and especially the BGM impressed me. If I think of a few scenes, the songs would start playing back inside my head as if imprinted onto the story. They emphasized the sad parts and the light-hearted parts, separating them perfectly. I'm glad the developpers included a music mode, if I ever feel like getting sad ಠ~ಠ. The animations and art are somewhat more of an older style and the story is short, but that doesn't mean anything bad and I enjoyed this vn :)

24309629.review:
[h1]欢迎大家光临天象馆，这里有着无论何时都决不会消失的，美丽无穷的光辉，满天的星星们正在等待着大家的到来。[/h1]

在B站看到了星之梦的动画版本,我没有再犹豫,从某宝以接近原价的价格买了她.虽然错过了之前特卖的半价.

说来惭愧,久仰Key社大名,然而这却是我这么多年玩的第一部Key社作品.

由于没有汉化补丁,我专门下载了中文台本,最后以英文字幕+中文台词+日语语音这种尴尬的方式,花了三个多小时才推完整个作品.

整部作品给我带来的,是深刻的思考.比如战争与利益,比如人与人之间的关系;也有对于自然乃至宇宙的无限感怀.

故事的基调从战争的萧索 到 天象馆中星空的璀璨与希望 再到离开时重回战乱那种壮烈 波澜起伏 感慨良多.

说实话,在放映过程中那段,我直接进入Auto模式,看着Kindle上的中文台词,听着日文语音,和男主一样想象着那种景象.真的是太美好了. 这足以值回游戏30+的售价.

如此绚烂的星空,然而许多人却不懂珍惜.还记得当年下晚自习偶然抬头看到繁星时的喜悦.然而那里是城郊,海边.市区严重的光污染使我们很难重温这种美丽.

同时,联想到最近因为南海问题炸出的一批键盘侠粪青,叫嚣着要打仗,真该让他们体会一下真正的战争是怎样的残酷,就像本作中描绘的这样.实在是令人愤慨.

(似乎已经跑偏了)

总而言之,剧情,音乐,CG,都十分出色.如果评分的话 我可能会给出9/10 毕竟作为"游戏",一路到底的剧情互动性还是单一了些,而且好多场景不知是不是出于版权保护无法截图.

24176456.review: Curta, divertida e emocionante. Planetarian nos introduz a um cenário pós-apocalíptico e somos acompanhados de uma personagem extremamente fofa durante praticamente toda a história a partir do momento que chegamos ao planetário.  São boas as referências e histórias das constelações e a narrativa vai te surpreendendo a medida que o tempo se passa, todos os sentimentos do planetário são muito bem apresentados pela robozinha. A trilha sonora acompanha bem a história e fui me apegando bastante à Yumemi enquanto o tempo se foi passando. Gostei bastante também de como a personagem vai conversando com o protagonista e vamos nos tornando mais próximos dela e a Key acertou em cheio, pelo menos comigo, nas reações desse protagonista, que quase sempre iam condizendo o que eu pensava, principalmente no final da história, quando as lágrimas não paravam de escorrer. Dito isso, mesmo sem nenhuma escolha a ser feita ou opção sendo mostrada na tela, consegui sentir que todas as minhas decisões eram "lidas" pelo personagem e bem interpretadas por ele.

24127606.review:
The [b]BEST[/b] Visual Novel I have ever seen.
A wonderful Sci-Fi AVG about a female robot who is similar with Asimov's.
Have finished it before and purchased it for the first time I saw it on Steam.
It's a sad but warm story in the wasteland.
It's one kind of the futures which may come true.
According to the [i]2001: A Space Odyssey[/i] which is a film produced in 1968, we thought we would have already built a huge Space Station or permanent bases on moon and would have the ability of sending manned spacecrafts to Jupiter controlled by an advanced A.I. in 2001.
Well, it's 2016 today and what have we done? A MUCH smaller one called I.S.S.?
In the past, we had predicted the future in a overly optimistic way and is there anyone can promise that we are not doing the same now?
That's why I fully immerse myself in the setting of the story. It's probably a real story in our future.
================================
BTW, the game totally refresh my impression in hard S.F. of the Key.
================================
The game is only a part of the world of the Planetarian. Read the Novel(script?) and you will have some insight into the whole world of it.
================================
The animated version of Planetarian will be released tomorrow.
It's worth watching.
I promise.

- Ending

Cons:

Overall I'd recommend this if you're already familiar with the VN genre. “请大家记住，即使有一天，星星的世界不再是遥不可及的梦想，而是成为了生活的一部分……也请大家不要把在这里看到的星空忘却。当您迷失在黑暗中，看不到真正的星空的时候，就请静静地将它回想起来吧。这是……我的小小的梦想。”

23748735.review:
I really liked the graphics and the voice actors, nothing can be said about the production itself. 

However, as a longtime Science Fiction veteran I had a big problem with the plot. This is supposed to be a world that has gone down the drain and you get glimpses of it by what the main character is telling. The overall mood though is so different because of the overenthusiastic robot and the light music. For me this didn't fit together, it never feels dangerous or like "fight-for-your-life". It's rather peaceful instead and the junker seems to enjoy the quiet time.

Next, the things that happen with the robot. It's very predictable and I found the whole affair unconvincing. The main character nerver succeeds in outwitting the robot and only at the end expresses what he sees in her. Read "Fondly Fahrenheit" from Alfred Bester or one of the many robot stories by Asimov. They go deeper and explore what it means to be a robot. 

Even from a philosophical point of view the story feels flat. Whenever it gets more serious it falls back to "I obey you" or "that's part of my programming". I guess I am spoiled by "Steins;Gate" and its heart wrenching consequences. 

If you want to enjoy a lightweight and predictable SF story then you came to the right place. For something serious I highly recommend "Steins;Gate".

23644745.review:
I'm not at all the type to cry.

Bought this game after hearing about how good Clannad is, despite it's art style. Still need to play that as of writing, but coming into the game, I trusted that it was going to be good. I was not at all let down. While I didn't cry, the mood that this kinetic novel, a game where there aren't any choices, had set was pretty obvious.

Our protagonist starts off finding our female lead, Yumemi, as annoying, as she's quite the chatterbox. But after spending time with her, he gets used to her antics. And my god, I found her so adorable. Really reminds me of Koboshi from Let's Meow Meow, so now that I know of Yumemi's existence, I now have two robots who are easily best girls.

I'm only 2 hours in, and haven't yet gotten through all of the chapters, but I have confidence the rest of the game will be good. As someone new to Ren'py, I really like the writing style. Haven't played other visual novels, it's interesting to note the way how a VN describes things. Steins;Gate and Corpse Party are perspective heavy, Nekopara (Volume 0 anyway) is dialogue heavy, while planetarian leans more towards description, although of course has dialogue as well.

I don't really have anything else to comment about the game, other than addressing one of the reviews negatively posted, where the reviewer obviously expected this game to have endings to get. Lol. Sorry to say that's not what kinetic novels are. One's like these are more like reading an anime/manga than anything else, which is not a bad thing.

23478893.review:
Even though this kinetic visual novel is pretty short (I'd guess 3-5 hours depending on your reading speed), it packs a pretty powerful emotional punch. The protagonist is a man in a post-apocalyptic world plagued with a constant rain who makes a living off of gathering valuable remnants of the previous world and selling them to interested parties. In his quest to find things in order to make a living, he goes into a broken down city that has been long abandoned by humans and finds an abandoned planetarium. In this planetarium, there is a robot who has been waiting almost 30 years for customers to visit. She was well loved before the apocalypse and wants to simply help people and show them the stars. This story is about their meeting and how they change each other by doing so. 

[b]Pros:[/b]
A very cute and sad story
Brings up good philosophical questions about the meaning of life
Good fully voiced dialogue (in Japanese)

[b]Cons:[/b]
Short story
Kinetic storyline

If you do get this, be prepared to cry. A lot.

As i read towards the end, it begin to rain heavily. Though the story is short, it also brought me new insight of life. Now, i really wish that robots like Yumemi existed in real life.

23410345.review: A sweet, sad kintetic novel about a strange encounter set during essentially the end of the world. It's strange how some stories really resonate with you and some don't. I did feel some sadness during this novel but at the same time, it didn't quite work for me either. Yumemi is more than just a machine, but the way she's written, I didn't reach the point where it felt she was truly alive, either. It could even be something that didn't quite come through in the translation but that was just my overall sense of it. The story is about 4 hours long, give or take a little bit depending on your reading speed. I happened to leave it running by mistake. This is not a story to make you feel any great happiness at any point so if you have an aversion to melancholy stories you might want to stay away. Otherwise, it's definitely still worth reading if you like visual novels. PS- Make sure you right click and change the font from the default if you are seeing overlapping letters.

23396529.review:
废土和机器人，两大老生常谈的Cliche

不过星野梦美还是比较有震撼力，从上述两个方面说

先说废土

想必辐射系列玩家在FNV里走进New Vegas，在F4里进Institute都有一种震撼感，“已经毁灭的旧时代的残片”摆在眼前的时候绝大多数人都是感慨万千，这么个机器人在已经毁灭的城市里继续编在程序里的日常工作就是这么个意思：把旧时代的残片以最大的表现力扔在玩家眼前。震撼力爆表。

再说机器人

机器人和AI自打一出现就是和人类做对比的，无论是终结者2最后一幕那句“如果连终结者，连一个机器都能知道人类生命的可贵，也许我们（人类）亦能。”这样用机器的中立衬托人类的邪恶本质，亦或是像System Shock系列的SHODAN和终结者系列的SKYNET那样用AI的阴险狡诈Resourceful来衬托玩家（人）那种不屈不挠永不后退的武士精神；两种做法都是通过有机和无机的对比增强一个表现力。这部作品做的也算是不错。三十年后仍然没有放弃岗位的机器人最后为了保护创造了一切也毁灭了一切的人类被打成零件...Bitter irony

唯一的问题是你要是通了上面那两部游戏也看过终结者1跟2......这游戏就基本震不到你了

23291712.review:
Planetarian est une VISUEL NOVEL courte linéaire, la lecture m’a pris que 4h30. Elle ne contient aucun choix.

L’histoire se passe dans un monde SF post-apocalyptique, l’humanité à quasiment disparue suite à une guerre biologique et nucléaire, les peu de survivants vivent sous une pluie acide  permanente et des machines de guerres les traquent. 
Nous incarnons un «Junker», sorte de pilleur de tombe, visitant les ruines de ville à la recherche d’objets de valeur. Ce junker finit par trouver refuge dans un planétarium.
Lorsqu’il atteint le dernier étage de ce bâtiment commercial, il fait la rencontre de Yumemi, un robot-hôtesse, qui lui annonce qu’en tant que 2 500 000ème client du Planetarium, il a droit à une projection commémorative spéciale!
Yumemi est absolument déterminée à lui présenter ladite projection commémorative, cependant le projecteur est brisé et nécessitera des réparations.
Comme il n’a pas vraiment mieux à faire, « The Junker » offre son aide pour la réparation du projecteur. Après tout, même s’il doit endurer une Yumemi qui ne cesse de parler, au moins il se sent en sécurité à l’intérieur du Planetarium. 

C'est une magnifique histoire émouvante, triste.

Le Junker (vous):
Un homme désabusé, cynique, taciturne.
Recouvert d’un parka pour se protéger des pluies toxiques, armé pour faire face aux dangers de la guerre, un nécessaire à filtrer l’eau, un sac. 
Votre état de santé n’est pas excellent et vous connaissez qu' une seule chose : la guerre.

Yumeni :
Bavarde et pleine d’énergie.
Un robot de protocole, dont le travail consiste à accueillir les visiteurs du planetarium et à leur faire une démonstration de « Miss Jena », la machine qui fait le show. Elle ne se rend pas compte des changements que la guerre a opéré et persiste à attendre des « clients » qui ne viendront jamais.
Même si Reverie n’est qu’un robot on finit par s’y attacher. Elle est adorablement chiante. 

Cette novel est surprenamment poignante pour une histoire aussi courte.
Si vous aimez les bonnes histoires avec de vraies sensations : lisez Planetarian. 
Un patch fr est disponible sur le net.

22925556.review:
This is a story about a grumpy, nameless junker and Hoshino Yumemi, a cute little robot that is the most beautiful human being in existance.

I admit I was a bit turned off at first due to lack of widescreen and gamepad support, and the linear nature of the story (might as well read a book, no?), but all those grievances quickly faded as I got further into the game. 

The voice acting is great, the music and art are beautiful in their simplicity and fit great together with the highly emotional story (If you watched Angel Beats, it kinda feels like episode 10). The game is a stark reminder that, for all the good things humanty has achieved in our brief existance, we are now more than ever on the verge of losing it all.

[b]PROS:[/b]
+ Beautiful story
+ Nice art
+ Fitting music
+ [i]"A sub-brand of VisualArt's, Key are also famed for creating Kanon, AIR, CLANNAD, Little Busters!, Rewrite, and Angel Beats!"[/i]

[b]CONS:[/b]
- Very short
- Linear
- No widescreen or gamepad support
- [i]"A sub-brand of VisualArt's, Key are also famed for creating Kanon, AIR, CLANNAD, Little Busters!, Rewrite, and Angel Beats!"[/i]

IMO, every world leader should be forced to play this VN before being sworn in.

22869125.review:
Planetarian is a beautiful sci-fi post-apocalyptic visual novel about hope in a world filled with despair. It has a great voice action and very melancholic soundtrack, that matches pretty well with the plot.

The story features a Junker (a scavenger of abandoned, old cities) who takes shelter in an abandoned planetarium in a city long abandoned by it's previous occupants. He is looking for food, drink and cigarettes while avoiding hostile warmonger robots, patrols, sentries and other Junkers. In the Planetarium, he encounters a sweet and dedicated robot called Hoshino Yumemi who sees the Junker as one of the visitors. Their relationship evolves into a deep and beautiful story of friendship, which makes this Visual Novel one of the best currently available in Steam.

I shed tears and you'll probably shed tears as well, be prepared.

毕竟是老游戏了，无论画质还是UI等等各方面已然显出陈旧，英文也不算好懂，但这些都没有办法阻止梦美带来的感动如光辉般发散开来，动人心弦。
应该说星之梦完满地符合了出色的Galgame的定义，陈旧画质亦不能掩盖的精良绘画、动听的音乐、当然最重要的是具有吸引力和深刻的思考空间的故事。对于评测，我想有这些就够了。多余的溢美之词并没什么用处。
当无数的丑恶挑战内心的纯洁时，总要有美好的东西作为抵御的力量而存在。大概这就是像星之梦这样的作品存在的意义吧。

22721151.review:
I wasn't sure about what to expect with one of these 'visual novels' but I love Anime and I love Japan so I thought why not?

The voice-acting is in Japanese. No English.

While the story does instil a sense of creeping dread about dwindling resources and keeps you wondering if the next moment will be the end.. most of the story is describing a world which I feel could have been done a bit better through anime or even more manga.

Even being a short story there's different levels to it and because it's well written I have to recommend it [i]when it's on sale[/i].

To sum it up without spoilers: The festering species on this planet decided to reach for the stars and were wiped out for their effort. It's all in a day's work.

You'd be horrified to find a dangerous fungus spreading out from your toilet bowl. First thing any decent person'd do is grab a bottle of bleach.

There, it may not quite be in-line with what the author intended but it fits suitably.

22705485.review:
[h1] 请不要将天堂分开… [/h1] 

作为KEY社经典催泪作品之一，星之梦讲述的并不是一个简单的情感，这部作品在短短的篇幅内向我们展示了十分深刻的思想。

[spoiler] 故事发生时间是在世界大战的许多年后，一位身经百战的废土猎人偶遇一个大战前的机器人的故事。这个机器人梦美饱含着战前人类美好的一面，与废土猎人的世界产生了强烈的对比。一边是满目疮痍、连绵阴雨的世界，一边是天真善良、勤劳努力的机器人，我觉得这正是人性中善与恶的对比。 [/spoiler] 

[spoiler]梦美拂去了废土猎人心中的浮尘，但是这人性的光辉最后还是在机动兵器的炮火下被摧残得体无完肤。[/spoiler] 

我们不仅要问，为什么人性之光在暴力面前如此的脆弱？

我们不仅要问，为什么人性之光在暴力面前如此的不堪一击？

这不禁然我想起了同题材的 《辐射4》中的一句话：War, war never changes。

人性中的恶可以非常轻易地摧毁人性中的善，也正因为如此，那些人性中闪光的珍宝才会如此的珍贵！

[spoiler]因此尽管星之梦的结局让人落泪，但我并不认为其是一个悲剧，因为与其说是梦美和废土客被摧毁，不如说是他们两个主动选择离开，为的就是守护人性中的那一丝美好。而最终梦美的记忆卡被保留了下来，也正印证了游戏的主题：守护人性中美好的部分。[/spoiler] 

[h1]
[u]欢迎大家光临天象馆，这里有着无论何时都决不会消失的，美丽的无穷光辉，满天的星星们在等待着大家的到来……[/u][/h1]

22700171.review:
非常好的游戏。我之前玩过原版（非Steam）的Windows版以及PS2版，但是因为那个年代正版游戏渠道受限，玩的都是盗版。现在终于在Steam上看到这款游戏了，我也是很激动。这款游戏的优点我就不说了，实在是太经典了。就想说个缺点，就是日语是Shift-JIS的，而不是现在大部分现代Steam游戏上的Unicode日语，因此在非日文系统上无法正常显示。虽然这个Steam版本加了English，但是多少还是有点奇怪。希望作者能好好修改，重新把Shift-JIS的日语都转换成Unicode再更新。

最近的版本似乎增加了成就。不过这个游戏是一个完完全全的Visual Novel，没有任何分支、选项，所以5分钟就可以 拿到所有成就了呢。但是，如果只是为了成就，是无法好好体验这个游戏的美的╮(╯_╰)╭

Very impressive game. I have played the original Japanese version on both Windows and Playstation 2. But due to the bad time when it was hard to buy oversea games in China, both version I played were pirates. Now, my excitement is beyond my expression, because I could finally pay for the game on Steam. Kudos to Steam!

I'm not going to tell you how amazing it is, since the only way to feel the game is to play it by yourself. The only con I find for this game is that its Japanese texts are encoded in Shift-JIS, not Unicode, and therefore it won't work on non-Japanese systems.

Yeah, I know, I could play it in English. But it's really weird to enjoy a typical Japanese Gal-Game in English, especially when you are fluent in Japanese. I wish the developer could convert all texts from Shift-JIS to Unicode, as all modern games do, so that we could enjoy the game in Japanese on more systems.

The latest update seems to have added achievements. It's not a bad idea for achievements fans, but you really can't expect too much, because [i]planetarian[/i] is a very pure visual novel with no choices at all. There is only one way to the only one ending, with only one heroine. No multiple endings, no multiple routes, no New Game+, no nothing.

It takes you at most 5 minutes to get all achievements. But is this a game from which you could enjoy yourself by getting achievements? This is purely a visual noval. This is an amazing visual novel that you'll never forget.

22476768.review:
Короткая кинетическая визуальная новелла от стюдии Key, которая всегда делает качественные и годные проекты. Действия новеллы разворачиваются в постапокалиптическом мире, где после атомной войны уничтожили почти всё население Земли и поэтому каждый день идёт непрерывный дождь. Первая половина игры происходит в планетарии, а вторая — в разрушенном городе.
Плюсы данной визуальной новеллы:
[h1]Музыка.[/h1] Отличное музыкальное сопровождение.Главная тема оставляет после себя приятное ощущение и даже наворачиваются слезы.
[h1]Сюжет.[/h1] Нам рассказывают историю сталкера, выживающего в этом сером постапокалиптическом мире. После скитаний, он решает наведаться в 1 город, о котором ему рассказывал его приятель. Там встечает геноида (девушку-робота) покинутой людьми, которая приглаешает прохожих посмотреть на их планетарий, к сожелению, за последние 30 лет - он 1 посетитель. История очень жизненная (возможно такое будущее скоро ждёт и нас) в конце может прошибить на слезу.
[h1]Персонажи.[/h1] Хоть их всего 2, но они очень хорошо прописаны и поэтмоу появляется сопереживание ГГ. Кудзуя -  бывший солдат с тяжелым характером, ищущий редкие предметы вроде сигарет или вина, а Юмэми - добрая и надоедливая; из-за некоторых поломок не подозревает о изменениях произошедших за 30 лет.
[h1]Атмосфера.[/h1] Атмосфера новеллы передается за счет отличных артов, эмбиента и прекрасной работе сейю. Очень атмосферный дождь. Когда проникаешься игрой полностью, действительно ощущаешь себя находящимся в шкуре ГГ.

Минусы:

[h1]Продолжительность.[/h1] 4 часа - это мало
[h1]Нету свободы действия.[/h1] В новелле нету ни 1 выбора. Возможно, кому-то это не покажется минусом , но все таки вариативность действий всегда лучше, чем просто следование 1 истории.

Planetarian - стоит своих денег однозначно, советую брать всем, даже тем кто в 1 раз слышит о визуальных новеллах.

22464651.review:
Planetarian The Reverie of a Little Planet

Hmmm, so coming into this VN I didn't know what to expect, I had heard quiet a lot about it but I was hearing a lot of mixed impressions, however I was pleasantly surprised to find what a great story it had, it was a very interesting read; and suffice to say I have reread this VN many times.

The Story is based long after a great war that left the world in darkness, most if not all life gone, acid rains ever covering the planet in an erosive downpour. 

Though a story just centered on what had happened to the planet would be good enough, then the  focus comes to two characters living 30 years after whatever tragedy had overcome the planet, and the journey they must take through this harsh world.

Length wise it is not the longest VN I have come across taking four to five hours depending on how fast you read, however it doesn't need to be any longer; it tells its story well in the period of time needed, any longer and the feel would be completely off, as if to make it worse by drawing it out so though some will be disappointed at its short length it is for the best.

The art style I must say is incredible, it has a certain charm to it; and not just the characters the backgrounds are very good also, the VN has a great use of colour to contrast between various scenes and locations.

The music is well done and adds to the atmosphere and complements the game quiet well, it really helps to immerse yourself in the story.

Overall Planetarian is beautifully written piece of work; It is visually appealing, the characters are interesting; learning about the pasts of the two main characters, seeing them interact, and seeing how the whole thing unfolds what you get is a story that is incredibly touching, anyone who likes Clannad, Air or any other of Key's works, Planetarian will be a welcomed addition to your library.

I'll leave you with this, Planetarian The Reverie of a Little Planet is a great read and will no doubt keep you interested throughout its duration....so why not give it a try.

(Like all my reviews I do not put a score as it is my belief that games like all forms of art are subjective and therefore it is impossible to afix a number to them)

Planetarian é uma Visual Novel curta, com apenas uma rota automática, onde não é preciso fazer nada, além de desfrutar da história e dos gráficos. E é mais do que o suficiente, pois a história é curta e muito bonita. A apresentação gráfica é de alta qualidade, com CGs belas. A parte sonora também não deixa a desejar, com boas músicas.

E o principal mesmo é a narrativa, que é bastante concisa, mas os diálogos são muito bem estruturados e o jogo consegue manter-se interessante apesar de revolver apenas em torno de poucos personagens. Uma coisa que gostei muito é que o jogo não procura recorrer muito a flashbacks para suprir falta de conteúdo; há apenas o necessário e eles não tiram o foco da história principal.

Por fim, a ginóide Hoshino Yumemi rouba a cena, e a representação dela é perfeita, pois tanto mais ela se mostra ser uma robô, mais você acaba se afeiçoando a ela como uma "pessoa". O efeito que ela causa é muito mais poderoso que os andróides e ginóides de outras histórias que são tão perfeitamente humanos que perdem a razão de ser. E, por fim, se o desfecho da história é excelente. Se a história de planetarian não te tocar, melhor consultar um médico.

22038689.review:
入手只为留下点什么。 

正了八经儿的写了一篇，当时被这个小萝莉感动cry，代入感强，确实不错的体验。

全文链接：
[url=http://www.gimmgimm.com/article/info?id=11147]hey，我的小萝莉~[/url]

战争与星星，一个近到毛孔渗血，一个远到烟花炫夜，对比越是激烈越是刺眼。猎人就这样来到了星空穹顶，就像写好的一样迎接他的到来。没人知道星野梦美是怎样独守的，每日、每夜、每一分钟，“[i] 为人类服务	[/i]”就是她的毕生追求。

猎人的不信任最终输给了梦美的执着，为她修好了“[i] 耶拿	[/i]”。当亮起的一刻，她在满是黑暗的屋内憧憬着说：“[i] 战争的时代结束了，世界上的人们携起手来，共同挑战宇宙时代到来了，向着更高更高的地方，跨国卫星通信网，航天飞机系统，国际太空港建设，再登月计划，越过光明的天空，摆脱夜晚的黑暗，将无数的泪珠化作新的梦想的结晶……	[/i]”

[h1] 星空属于永恒燃烧的钢铁般的心[/h1]

梦美就像是背负着神圣使命的天使，努力的向着黑暗伸开了双臂，又像是固执的孩子，就算同伴离开仍旧相信会有客人光临，“没被遗忘”就是它工作的理由，“工作”就是让人相信它的存在。但最终她仍旧被同类击杀了，就像所有的美丽心灵一样，在战争面前无辜而脆弱。

[h1] 消亡是所有事物的唯一归宿，
梦美执行着保护人类的命令，
而这也是他们的骄傲所在……	[/h1]

想起了梦美的祈祷“[i] 请不要关闭机器人的天堂	[/i]”，机器人的梦想是简单的，她的认知限于人类编写的程序，也许对于神来讲我们的位置也同机器人一样，他们在穹顶观望，静静看着人世间，等待着主角们来到穹顶，再向他们展示不曾理解的事物——所以神啊，也请不要关闭人类的天堂。

[h1] 也许一切都是一厢情愿，只是不切实际的另一面不也叫希望么？[/h1]

在废土世界，星空就如梦美对战争的理解般遥远又虚无缥缈，但我宁愿相信戴在她头上的发卡是为猎人而容，宁愿相信打进她眼里的雨水是真的眼泪。

最后要感谢制作组这个星空穹顶的守望者，在不知名的时空里等待每一位来访的顾客，然后竭尽全力的为我们讲述着……

即使这是星空之野下的美梦……

22015567.review:
A short and very sweet visual novel with outstanding localisation.

The way the world is built up around the main character's current situation is orchestrated wonderfully. The dull and grey animated city backgrounds and the descriptions verging on poetic make it easy for the reader to form a strong sense of the world being portrayed -- and that's coming from someone who hardly ever reads books, partly *because* I can't visualise them well.

Watching the main character develop as chapters progress is the other best thing about planetarian. It never felt forced (though a bit rushed at the end), it was always interesting, and it keeps the story moving at the perfect pace.

One more point to emphasise: the brilliant translation/localisation. I remember seeing only one grammar error in total, and it was minor. There's a point where they use the 'when in Rome' saying: I thought to myself, "oh no, they're not using this right at all", but the next line proved me wrong. Seriously, it's a pleasure to read.

Having only played a few VNs before I think I can say reasonably safely that this would be a great starting option for people who haven't played many before. planetarian is 100% non-interactive, so stay away if you prefer choices in your visual novels -- but for anyone else, especially if you enjoy sci-fi, this game is a great pick.

2016-07-25 edit: Yeah it's still an amazing experience. I was constantly impressed with how well the story reads. Good variety of music to fit different scenes. For anyone interested, it takes 4.5 hours to read through in auto mode with a slightly faster than default speed setting.

21982951.review:
[i]planetarian[/i] is an emotional piece of work, and one I didn't know what to expect from.

The story is very basic, a scavenger who the game calls the Junker ends up in an abandoned city destroyed by a huge war that decimated most of the planet to look for supplies. In this city he ends up inside an abandoned Planetarium, where he meets a robot named Yumemi. She offers a projection for him of the night sky, something he has never had the chance to see, and agrees to fix the broken projector in order to get that reward.

That's all the story summary I'll give, but suffice to say, it is quite good. However, I didn't really get very emotional until the last half-hour or so, but by then, I was most certainly bawling my eyes out. The main meat of the story is just the building relationship between the Junker and Yumemi, which is the only reason it works at all.

In terms of graphics and sound, the game is fine. I wouldn't really say the music is anything too special, especially not compared to Key's other Visual Novels, but it gives just the right atmosphere and mood for each scene, so that it's not really that much of a problem. Yumemi and the backgrounds are fairly well drawn and detailed, and the game is fully voiced (Japanese only).

The only big turn-off this game has is in it's length and asking price. As much as I recommend this story, $10 is a [b]really[/b] steep price for something that lasts all of 3-5 hours with very little replay value. Granted, I'm the kind of guy who can read stuff like this multiple times, but I can't speak for others. I'd recommend waiting for a sale on this one, but whether you pay full-price or discounted, this experience is well worth it.

21962330.review:
В Планетариан первый раз поиграл шесть или семь лет назад на английском языке. С тех пор 2 раза перепроходил с двумя различными вариантами перевода на русский. Что же имеем?
	Сюжет повествует о Старьевщике  в постаповском мире, который волей случая попадает в планетарий с работающим роботом Хошино Юмеми (она уже 30 лет ждет новых посетителей). Весь дальнейший сюжет крутится вокруг взаимоотношения между ними.
	Сразу же отмечу достоинства:
[list]
	[*] Краткость игры не сказалось на персонажах. Они достаточно хорошо проработаны, особенно Юмеми.
	[*] Сюжет так и норовит вышибить слезу, а концовка вообще заставит плакать.
	[*] На удивление – неплохо переданная атмосфера постапокалипсиса. Скажу честно – совсем не ожидал при первом прохождении.
	[*] В целом, достаточно неплохо прорисованы как фоны, так и персонажи (точнее, сама Юмеми).
	[*] И, самое главное, – музыка. Магоме Тогоши постарался на славу, а Gentle Jena до сих пор периодически звучит в голове под настроение.
[/list]
	Недостатки же банальны:
[list]
	[*] Собственно, по факту Планетариан не совсем игра, а кинетическая новелла. То есть на сюжет повлиять никак нельзя - сиди, тыкай на кнопку мыши\пробел и читай. А если и тыкать лень – ставь на авто чтение и разваливайся в кресле. Может многих ввергнуть в тоску. [i]Сразу оговорюсь – это не минус. Нельзя же ругать кинетическую новеллу за то, что она кинетическая новелла...[/i]
	[*] Однако из-за этого возникает вопрос уже не к самой игре, а к ее издателю. 250р (или 10$, что еще страшнее) за 4 часа тыкания мышкой? Окей, хорошо, но не для игры, которая вышла почти 11,5 лет назад! В конце концов Планетариан был выпущен в Стиме ради пеара Кеевцев перед выходом Кланнада. Очевидно же, что лучше выпустить ее бесплатной для более массового охвата. Ладно, издателю виднее…
[/list]

	В итоге, скажу, что Планетариан обязателен к прочтению тем, кто его еще не читал. Остальным же покупать игру рекомендовал бы разве только ради очистки совести. От оценки воздержусь – игра ей не поддается.

P.S. И касаемо вышеупомянутого Кланнада – 900р за игру, хоть она, и, мягко говоря, помасштабнее Планетариана, но вышла уже 12 лет назад… Ладно, издателю виднее.

21951626.review:
A short but well crafted Visual Novel, from presentation, to the art, to the music. It fires on all cylinders, tells the story it wants to tell, and does so without overstaying its welcome, without ostentatiousness, without leaving you feeling short.

It's a tale about a dying world brought about by our own self destructive tendencies, a man who survives by ekeing out an existence robbing tomb cities guarded by autonomous machines of death, and his encounter with a lone android abandoned in a planetarium, unable to do anything else but what she was created to do, which is simply to show you the stars. 

Some may balk at the price of admission for such a short tale (My time shown is pretty much how long it'll take for one to finish the story) but I feel it is well worth it given how well crafted all the features are--It is also voiced too. If it truly is an issue, you can wait for a sale, where it'll truly be worth it if you're into visual novels with a post apocalyptic setting.  


It's a melancholy tale that'll make an impression that sticks with you if nothing else.

21948150.review: Might make you cry, just a heads up.

21948039.review:
This is a short and unusual visual novel about a Junker who takes shelter in an abandoned planetarium long abandoned by its previous human occupants to search for food, drink and cigarettes while avoiding hostile Warmonger robot patrols and sentries. The Junker encounters a robot greeter Hoshino Yumemi who sees the Junker as its 2497490th visitor and customer at the planetarium(space-themed movie projection theater with shopping mall) from a bygone age before humans were forced to evacuate from the city and the city was bombed with germ bombs. 

Although there are no choices to make at all in this game, the CG, soundtracks, and overall game presentation are nicely done. Reading through the storyline and dialogue, unlocking the CG and music gallery and obtaining all achievements will take about 2 hours.

I have also nominated this game for I'm not crying, there's something in my eye award in November 2016 Autumn Sale.

21929119.review:
Get ready for some major punches right in the feels. T_T

This reminded me a bit of a Ray Bradbury story in some ways. 
Without spoiling anything, here is a description. This is the story of a man living in a post-apocalyptic world who travels from place to place in search of valuable items left behind or not yet discovered by other "junkers." He comes across a robot who no longer really has a purpose in the world. Despite this, she (the robot is made to look like a young girl) is still happy and working hard even though there is no need, because it's all she knows. He is irritated by her ceaseless talking and sunny disposition but eventually comes to care about her and forms a somewhat-friendship. They have a lot of interesting/sad/humorous conversations throughout the story and eventually set out on a small adventure. 

That's all I can really say without spoiling too much. It's a touching story and if you haven't tried a visual novel on Steam I definitely reccomend this one. I know some people don't like them because there's usually little-to-no gameplay but this one has a good story and it's worth the read.

21922970.review:
Восхищаясь прекрасным и вечным сиянием звёздного неба, человек нет-нет, да и почувствует лёгкую меланхолию, мимолётную грусть по давно угасшим звёздам, чей свет до сих пор достигает его глаз. Может, миллионы звёзд на небосводе уже давно мертвы, прекратили существовать, были преобразованы и, можно сказать, сломаны, но дивный свет, испускаемый ими при жизни, ещё миллиард лет будет простилаться до самых удалённых уголков вселенной.

	Визуальная новелла "Planetarian", созданная небезызвестной студией "Key", истинными мастерами рассказывать красивые и чувственные истории, повествует о случайной встрече человека с роботом в антураже постапокалипсиса. Повествует о встрече грубого грязного и жестокого с вежливым чистым и добрым.

	Первый - сборщик утиля, имя которого не сообщается, да по сути и не важно. Всю свою осознанную жизнь только и делает, что сражается в попытках не дать себя убить да найти полезный мусор, который cможет впоследствии выгодно продать. Старьёвщик, озвученный Дайсукэ Оно, представлен усталым циничным молодым парнем. Как человек он больше не стремится к прекрасному, не создаёт ничего нового и не размышляет о вечном. Он лишь поглощает останки былой цивилизации, в ожидании неминуемой смерти.

	Вторая - робот-рассказчик по имени Хошино Юмеми. Эта маленькая "Звёздная Мечта" всю свою жизнь провела в планетарии, с любовью рассказывая истории о звёздном небе. После практически полной гибели человечества она продолжает ожидать новых посетителей. Продолжает верить, что однажды вновь придут люди, желающие познать удивительный мир звёзд, и одарят Юмеми словами благодарности да тёплыми улыбками. Милая и добрая девушка-робот, озвученная Кэйко Судзуки, представляет собой изысканную технологию, созданную лучшими умами былой цивилизации, для которой нет места в новом мире.

	А новый мир является изрядно изменённым старым. Изменённым, конечно же, химическим, биологическим, ядерным и другим оружием. Непомерные амбиции человечества в очередной раз вылились в глобальный конфликт, который, в отличие от предыдущих, стал для цивилизации точкой невозврата. Теперь количество людей ничтожно, земля заражена радиацией, а небо затянуто тучами.

	Непрекращающийся дождь нового мира льёт и над местом действия новеллы, над покинутым людьми городом. Его пустые улицы да брошенные дома стали лишь памятниками некогда великого устремлённого в будущее человечества. Цивилизация погибла, оставив после себя технические устройства, различные механизмы и приспособления, изучая которые можно восхититься некогда высокоразвитым обществом, способным сотворить настолько невероятные вещи. И в этом городе находится планетарий, единственное место, в котором ещё можно увидеть звёзды. Именно в планетарии и происходит встреча героев.

	И встреча их скоротечна, длится всего несколько дней, что в сравнении со всей жизнью можно считать лишь мигом. За несколько дней, за несколько действительно важных событий для сюжета, жизни персонажей истории кардинально меняются. При этом авторы данного произведения успевают вызвать у читателя и радость, и грусть, страх, беспокойство, удивление, восхищение, умиротворение. За несколько часов чтения новеллы, студия "Key" успевают раскрыть персонажей и рассказать прекрасную историю, которая имеет возможность, благодаря хорошему тексту, приятной музыке, красивому визуальному ряду и замечательной игре актёров, остаться в сердцах игроков трогательным воспоминанием, очаровательным и милым напутствием.

	"Planetarian" - это короткая кинетическая новелла, которую можно советовать для прочтения многим людям. Это маленький брильянтик, сверкающий всеми своими гранями, и игриво сияющая звёздочка на небосводе, чьё прекрасное и вечное сияние не погаснет никогда и ни за что.

I purchased this game due to the fact it had overwhelmingly positive reviews and it was on sale.  I should of paid closer attention to what this was.  

First off it is not a game.  It is strictly a Novel to read sort of like a comic book or manga.   If you're not into Manga then this is a total waste of money.  Japanese seem to have some weird fetish with young girls especially with cat ears that I find creepy.  In this story it's a robot that looks like a 15 year old and about as dumb and naive as one which is intended to be "cute" and help the reader make an emotional connection with the character, but it is just a robot and one that talks a lot making it very annoying, which again I think is supposed to lend it to being 'cute'.   Only for serious manga readers with a little girl fettish.

21900205.review:
Planetarian ~the reverie of a little planet- уже старенькая и коротенькая новелла, но с довольно трогательной историей. После прохождения у меня долгое время появлялись мысли подобного содержания: "А зачем вообще люди убивают друг друга за клочки земли, которые в итоге лишь станут пустынными и заброшенными?" "Зачем люди пытаются стать великими благодаря войне, ведь после нее некому будет вспомнить их имена?". Эта игра наглядный пример, что будет если разгорится 3-я Мировая Война и мы не перестанем игнорировать проблемы экологического характера, которые сегодня стоят перед нами. 
Что же насчет самой истории, она разворачивается в пост-апокалиптическое время, одном из заброшенных городов. Играя за одного из многих Старьевщиков, который думал найти что-то драгоценное в том самом заброшенном городе, случайно натыкается на девочку-робота, которая  даже спустя 30 лет после "конца света" работает в том загадочном планетарии на последнем этаже одного из торговых центров.
Музыки в игре мало, но надоесть она не успевает и идеально подходит к происходящему на экране. Фонов и артов так же немного, но они хорошо прорисованы в стилистике пост-апокалипсис, где идет непрекращающийся дождь. 
В заключении хочется отметить, что эта новелла предоставит вам еду для размышлении, а в конце, даже такая бесчувственная скотина как я, разрыдалась как маленькая девочка. у которой забрали конфету. К прохождению рекомендую.

21898869.review:
[h1]悲剧是将人性中有价值的东西毁灭给人看[/h1]
星之梦这款游戏，在我看来，早已超越了一般仅仅停留在爱情基础上的galgame，篇幅虽短，但思想深刻。
我认为它揭露了，[b]人性本恶，但向善[/b]的特质。
在未来世界，技术水平的发展远不及人类贪欲的膨胀速度，终于，为了争夺领土和资源的世界大战爆发，人性中疯狂的贪欲按下了毁灭的按钮。人类数量骤减，地球的环境也发生了翻天覆地的变化，陷入永恒的雨季。可是剩下的人类非但不团结一起生存下去，反而相互仇恨，杀戮。
[b]贪与恨的本质是自私，而自私便是人性之恶。[/b]
在战争之后的世界中长大的一名废墟猎人，从小到大见惯了人性之恶，却在一名机器人少女的身上见识到了人性向善的一面。
这个故事中最棒的设计恐怕就在于将善的部分体现在一名机器人的身上。人类在编写星野梦美的程序中为什么要把这些善良的品质编写进去呢？仔细想想会发现其实星野梦美作为接待机器人有很多地方做得并不好。她会为了给老婆婆指路，自己从天象馆跑出去。她会让没钱买票的小孩子免费观看投影。如果是为了追求利益最大化而生产的接待机器人是不应该让她们有这样的行为的。作为世界最初的自律型机器人解说员的研究开发人员正是相信人性中向善的一面才将这些程序编写进去。
而结局却告诉我们[b]人性本恶的部分不旦会摧毁人类自身，而且还会摧毁人性中向善的一面[/b]
实际上我们看开头，老废墟猎人的话就可以预见到结局了
在男主在与移动炮台作战的时候我们看到了男主预想的一种美好的结局，所以在看到真实残酷的结局以后会觉得十分惋惜和遗憾。
可是仔细想想，即便男主很完美的打败了移动炮台，带着星野梦美逃出去了，这种预想真的能实现吗？
男主得到了星野梦美的记忆卡时，明明可以赶快跑路逃出去，之后想办法弄个机器人把卡装上去，带着梦美实现他这样美好的预想的。可是为什么最终男主却放下武器，等死呢？
[u]“不要搭理它们，它们根本不属于这个世界。”[/u]
[u]（这个世界的人类早已没有向善的一面了）[/u]
[h1]任何生物都是自私的，但人类之所以能与其它物种区分开来正是在于向善的一面，当人类不再向善之时，就是人类不再为人之时[/h1]

プラネタリウムはいかがでしょう？来看看我们的天文馆如何呢？
どんな时でも决して消えることのない、美しい无穷のきらめき。无论何时都不会消逝的美妙无穷的光辉
満天の星星が皆様をお待ちしています。满天的星星在等着各位
以前从来没有玩过key社游戏，所以感受绝无任何跪舔之嫌
[b]未打码的地方内容轻微剧透，打码属于剧情主要内容为严重剧透[/b]
看见key社游戏打折，这个最便宜。。所以我就买了。。
流程不长，一个晚上就打完了
游戏设置在一场大战之后，全篇的人物也很少，主要就是捡垃圾的男主和投影馆机器人星野梦见
男主在捡垃圾的过程中莫名其妙就走到天文投影馆里面去了，然后就展开了一系列的对话
一开始主角很讨厌这个机器人，因为她就喜欢在那里不停地逼逼，好不容易最后听不下去她的逼逼同意看关于宇宙的投影，结果特[spoiler]特么的机器坏了，于是男主就开始帮她修，也正是接这个机会男主开始重新审视这个机器人，以及世界和人生
当男主成功修好机器，看完这家投影馆最后一次演出（也是机器人的最后一次解说）之后，带上机器人去找车子，结果途中遇到战斗型的机器人，这个时候男主准备奋力一搏，于是让机器人在原地等待。然而男主敌不过强大的敌人，就在千钧一发之际，星野出现在他的眼前，暴走男主男主再次睁开眼睛之后，只看到两个机器人的残骸，敌人的，和新野的。当男主问起，我不是叫你在原地等我吗，星野说，一开始出厂设定就是这样，不能加害于人类，也不能对人类见死不救。男主叹道，机器人被人创造出来，却又因为人类设定的条例而死[/spoiler]
整个游戏没有花太多的文字去让人物和背景丰满厚重起来，而只是用男主和机器人之间的互动就很自然地引出了一系列值得思考的又很沉重的问题。关于机器人的感情，关于这个世界，关于这个宇宙，关于人与机器人之间。星野提到关于天堂的事情，她不希望天堂一分为二，人和机器人都能够愉快相处，她也希望为人类服务，这是她的快乐她的幸福，这实在是讽刺。游戏的大部分场景都在那个只有一个人和一个机器人的投影馆，很合适地渲染出那种后启示录世界的孤独和荒凉。值得一提的是游戏音乐也非常赞

请不要让天堂一分为二

21641225.review:
Planetarian ~the reverie of a little planet~ is a beautifully written, moving visual novel.

The writing is superb (if a little verbose at times - but I'll chalk that up to translation). I was drawn in from the very beginning. I loved the sound effects, the references to the rain and the foreshadowing was all very well done. The artwork was good, and helped to tell the story, especially when combined with the sound effects.

The story is beautiful, and very poignant. WIthout revealing too much, it's a nice discussion about the ambitions and flaws of humanity. There is a very fitting score for the game, which fits the mood of the various settings, and really helps tell the story.

Being a Visual Novel, there isn't anything to say regarding gameplay or controls - you just click your way through. The interface is easy enough to navigate and saving your game is easy. I played this with the steam controller - as it meant I could sit in bed and play. Anything you use to click your way through is fine.

The VN does an excellent job of giving backstory, and building up characters and their relationships.. It's also very effective at setting a tone of isolation. I absolutely enjoyed this VN and it pressed all the right buttons for me. After I finished the story last night, I felt very quiet and reflective. Emotions abound.

Simply superb.

21267115.review:
First off, for people new to the genre, this is a kinetic novel, meaning there are no choices, no paths. It's just text and images and music, and it tells a beautiful and bittersweet story.

It follows two characters from the moment they meet. One, a "junker", a man who braves autonomous military robot infested ruins in search of valuable relics of an earlier age. The other, a servant robot, tasked with running an old planetarium, who's been faithfully waiting for thirty years for the return of co-workers and customers that no longer exist in this post-apocalyptic world.

What's really brilliant is how well the writers conveyed the lonliness of an artificial intelligence that was designed to serve human beings. Her behavior patters clearly indicate a desperate need to interact with people, even as her possible behavior's are limited. Lonliness, even anguish, are portrayed through the juxtaposition of various pre-programmed behaviors. It was as heart-wrencing as it was brilliant.

Won over in spite of himself, the junker attempts to repair the projector so she can run another planetarium show. Does he succeed? What happens after? To go any further would be to spoil the story beyond what is reasonable.

A word on whether or not the ending is happy or sad, since that seems to matter to some people. [spoiler]It is not happy. It is bittersweet, at best. It is very sad. If you don't like sad endings, you might be disappointed. Then again... you might not. The game doesn't cost much, so give it a try.[/spoiler]

21239345.review:
For anyone who likes CLANNAD, Air or Angel Beats! they will enjoy this kinetic visual novel.  Put it on autoplay and sit back to read. (Since I read all three of those manga and have watched the anime, plus "know" the types of stories Key puts out, I knew what I was getting into even before I bought this "game".  Let us just say I knew what type of ending this would have before I started, and bought it anyway.)

Storyline: A Junker (a scavenger, really) on a future post apocalytic Earth accidently (and quite possibly by fate) runs across a non-lethal still functioning companion robot named Hoshino Yumeni.  Yumeni is the caretaker of a department store planetarium. (I am sure the word, planetarian, in the title is simply a misspelling.)  Still performing her duties as greeter and narrator, Yumeni greets 'Mr. Customer' formally and politely.  She offers to show him a special presentation of "the starry sky", a sky which in reality is covered with perpetually falling toxic rain.  There in that forgotten planetarium in the middle of a biologically contaminated and abandoned lethal 'Sarcophagus City' patrolled by murderous mechanized war machines these two share a reverie (a daydream) of a once and "future" world.

Excellent story, and have a box of tissue handy.

21216894.review:
So I picked this little game on sale, knowing it was from Key. And in case you don't know, this studio likes to literally fuck with your feels. So I knew what I was going into.

So, what is this game? This is a kinect visual novel, that means it literally is a book with pictures, music and voice acting. In most VN you can choose your own ending by making choices that affect it. Here, it is just like normal book: one plot line from the beggining to the end.

What is the story? It is about man, imply called "Jumker", who once visits planetarium, where lonely robot, called Hoshino Yumemi, wants to show your stars, but unfortunetely, the projector is broken. I believe that is all you need to know about this game. I was certainly suprised how grimm this story is and even more of its setting. I highly recommend you to NOT read the summary and/or tags, I think it kinda ruins the whole suprise thing. But why? Because the story is so touching that you should experience the bad things as you play, not before you even start. At least that is how I look at it.

I can't really say much about the story because I would just spoil it. Let's move on chacters. There are only two. The main protagonist, "Junker" (yeah, we don't get to know his name) and Hoshino Yumemi. Junker is your solitary protagonist, minding his own bussines. Yumemi is the polar opposite. Robots in this world are programmed to serve and obey humans. She cares about our hero only because her software is telling her so. Oh, and she is very, but very talkative. Even though Yumemi is robot and is behaving like one, there is no way you won't think of her as a human for at least one time. And that is truly something. We are constantly reminded that she is indeed robot, both by her actions, dialog and by narrator. And yet, I could not help myself but think of her as a human. It was not her character sprite, it was the writing that has done so. And I did not even notice it. There was a perfect balance between reminding us that she is just a robot and making her feel so human. It was just incredibly well made. The sprite, the voice acting, the dialog, everything worked.

The chemistry bewtween these two is also quite noticible, especially near the end. I did not believe that all was Yumemi was doing for Junker was because her software told her so. I just didn't. And I think that was the point. I think it is amazing that they managed in less the 5 hours make robot feel more human then our main character and everybody else in the world. 

And speaking or writing, you could just rip it out of this game, paste it on paper and nobody would really notice that this was at first VN. Unlike some other VNs at Steam, this is a huge achievemnt. That is not to say rest of it is completely unnecessary. 

I can say like 10 words in Japanese so I have no right to judge the voice acting. Yes, this novel is fully voice acted, even MC got his own voice actor. But VA of Yumemi was just joy to listen to. Her voice felt robotic and human at the same time. Junker does not really talk much with the exception of the ending. But he gives of that "lone wolf" vibe, if it makes sense. Nonetheless, they were both very entertaining.

The art in this game is great. Yumemi's design is just gorgeous, you can see for yourself in the pics above. The overall art really helps the atmosphere. However, one issue I have with the look of this game is its layout. I don't understand why they thought making the background one small imagine and putting it on the top of the screan and filling the rest with some random gears while putting the text into the box at the bottom was a good idea. It feels odd, especially since Yumemi covers the entire right part of the screen and it does not really add to anything in my opinion. Some images cover almost the entire screen too, that looked great, I don't know why they made almost the entire game like that. And another thing, the whole escape menu looks exactly the same as your choice options when you right click on your desktop. It looks bad and incredibly out of place.

Soundtrack for most part is quite nice. The whole soundtrack, as far as i know, is around 40 minutes long. That being said, it is the something I would want to listen to while doing something else. The one track that, however, stood out was Gentle Jena. My god, this song is the definition of beautiful. Go and listen to an extended version, you won't regret it.

There are in total 19 achievemnts, two of which you get for entering CG Mode and Music mode, which you unlock at the after you finish the game. You can finish it in less then 3 hours if you are fast reader and you are not using voice acting (which I don't recommend). Yes, it is very short. But I don't think that is a problem. Who said all good stories had to be super long? But that brings another issue- the price. 10€ for 3-5 hours long game is too much. Wait for it to be on sale.

TL;DR
pros:
+story, simple, yet beautiful
+charcters
+Yumemi's design
+atmosphere
+chemistry
+art
+its messege
+feels included for all you masochists like me ^^

cons:
-layout
-lazy and ugly in-game menu
-price

Final Verdict: 9/10

Just like every other game made by Key, this is also beautiful and simple tale with powerful message, nice art and good soundtrack to support it all. But despite its pros, it is not really worth 10€. Put it to your wish list and wait for sale, then buy it as fast as you can, you won't regret it.

I also recommend this game to everyone who is interested in VN but has yet to find a good place to start. Just like I said it is very short, so you won't really feel like you have wasted too much time if you end up disliking it.

21140493.review:
*SPOILER FREE REVIEW!*

There's a lot of debate as to whether the price of this visual novel is justified, considering its length, so here's an attempt to set it straight.  Warning: if you have a heart, you will enjoy this adventure regardless of the price!

Key is renowned for producing emotional VNs that tug on the heartstrings, supported by a good soundtrack, striking visuals and memorable characters that will stick with you long after you stop playing.  I can say that Planetarian fulfils all of those criteria in different ways.  There's just one difference: it's very short.  I'm quite an avid reader and can take a lot of narrative without a break, so I completed Planetarian in one 3 hour sitting.  I didn't race through it though; I paused for reflection and to enjoy the story at points.  However, if you're a slower reader or would prefer to enjoy the story in smaller bouts, you'll get more mileage out of it.

Considering the VN itself, I'm not going to lie - my immediate impression was 'oh, this is the VN Key put out as filler between bigger projects'.  The fonts are a little glitchy to read in places.  The visuals were slightly too pixellated on full screen mode - I had to switch to windowed to gain clarity.  And the soundtrack, for the most part, wasn't massively memorable, though it contributed to the atmosphere.  Sounds like a list of faults that make this VN probably not worth it, right?  That's not quite the whole story.

Despite my original doubts about Planetarian, the more I read, I found myself getting sucked into the story at a rapid pace and becoming attached to its characters, of which there are few, but that just makes those who appear all that more compelling.  I won't mention plot points in case of spoilers, but the more your choiceless story moves uncontrollably towards a both heartbreaking and affirming end you knew might come, the more you feel.  There are no choices to make.  There is nothing you can do to affect the story.  You can't stop what's inevitably going to happen...  but when you reach that ending and consider the short journey you took to get there, you really feel things.  The fragility of the human world.  The stupidity power can inspire.  The beauty hidden within the things that are right there in front of your eyes...  yes, it's more like paying for a movie ticket rather than buying an interactive game, but I can promise you that you will feel things that will make you forget that ticket price.

Okay, yes, it's probably a good idea to wait until this VN is on sale to make you feel a bit better about it...  but in all honesty, Planetarian began in my mind as a potential mistake, and turned into something I truly enjoyed and don't regret spending a single penny of that price for.  It was truly touching, like an anime you didn't expect to make you cry at the end...  oh, did I mention you might cry?  Yeah, it's a possibility.  I TOTALLY didn't , of course.  *cough*

Summary:  Begins in a way that doesn't promise much, but within five minutes, sucks you in and delivers a heartfelt, honest and moving little tale you'll be glad to experience.  Nice visuals, with lots of movement in the CGs, which is rare for VNs at times - gives you a break from static sprites on static backgrounds.  Soundtrack appears rather average until you're hit with the beautiful vocal-laden dream of a song at the end.

Only real drawback?  You might start Googling around for the nearest planetarium when you're done.

20487327.review:
Planetarian ~the reverie of a little planet~ (ou Chiisa Hoshi no Yume, "o sonho de uma pequena estrela, no original) é uma Kinetic Novel produzida pela Visual Art's/Key, escrita por Yuichi Suzumoto.
Para quem conhece a empresa, já sabe o que aguarda: um turbilhão de emoções e lágrimas.
Não distante do autor Jun Maeda (outro grande mestre da Visual Art's/Key, Planetarian conta com uma estrutura similar. Repleta de situações por vezes cômicas, por outras tristes e de partir o coração, faz com que essa pequena história reverbere como um gigante.

A história gira em torno de um mundo que acabou por uma grande guerra causada pela insesatez e arrogância humana. O resultado são armas automatizadas que exterminam seres humanos e uma chuva ácida que nunca para, cobrindo o céu do dia e da noite.

O personagem central, noemado apenas por sua profissão Junker, encontra Hoshino Yumemi, uma robô guia alegre e tagarela. Pouco a pouco, o jeito frio e cético do personagem central ganha ânimo e esperanças com a ingenuidade e gentileza da pequena robô abandonada.

Mais uma vez, a Visual Art's/Key utiliza com maestria elementos de ficção e sobrenaturalidade em uma história de drama de arrancar algumas lágrimas.

Planetarian não é uma história de amor, mas sim, uma história repleta de críticas do comportamento humano e de como a beleza e gentileza encontram-se em pequenos gestos, pequenos momentos, em um universo infinito muito maior que todos nós.

Apesar disso, Planetarian é um jogo bastante curto. Possui aproximadamente 5 a 6 horas de leitura, caso o jogador queira ouvir todos os diálogos (o jogo é dublado em japonês).

A tradução feita pela norte americada Sekai Project é muito boa. Apesar de alguns erros de digitação, não senti muitas discrepâncias em relação ao diálogo vocal e ao texto traduzido.

Há um problema em relação a fonte. Caso o seu computador não tenha a fonte padrão do jogo, você precisará selecionar outra. No meu caso, isso atrapalhou um pouco em alguns momentos já que em algumas cenas o texto passar por cima da arte, dificultando um pouco a leitura, mas nada muito sério.

Também tem a review completa no [url=https://medium.com/nerd-articles/review-planetarian-the-reverie-of-a-little-planet-chiisana-hoshi-no-yume-449c446a60a6#.fqxoknoa3] Nerd Articles[/url]

Tears? What are you talking about?
Those aren't tears... it's just raining...
in my room...

A short visual novel (~4 hours) that is equal parts beautiful and painful. The scenario:

The last remnants of humanity fighting for survival carrying out a decades old war which has wiped out the majority of life leaving nothing but an ever present acid rain to slowly erode the planet.

That is a fantastic backstory by itself, but take that and focus in on two individuals living 30 years after the aftermath, while learning about their pasts, seeing them interact, and seeing how the whole story unfolds you end up with a visual novel that is incredibly touching. Even at planetarian's corniest moments even when you know those moments are going to be there before you start the game you still can't help but smile or tear up when those moments arrive. 

Two well written characters, great music, nice art, and a backstory that isn't as far fetched as it should be all come together to make a must play game for fans of VN's who aren't afraid to feel a little something once in a while.
